snippet: In Tuesday's New York Times, Andrew Ross Sorkin looks at how many users Facebook really has, pointing out that the company counts as "active" users anyone who presses a "Like" button or shares a Twitter message, as well as people who go to the Web or...
abstract: In Tuesday's New York Times, Andrew Ross Sorkin looks at how many users Facebook really has, pointing out that the company counts as "active" users anyone who presses a "Like" button or shares a Twitter message, as well as people who go to the Web or mobile site.
lead_paragraph: In Tuesday's New York Times, Andrew Ross Sorkin looks at how many users Facebook really has, pointing out that the company counts as "active" users anyone who presses a "Like" button or shares a Twitter message, as well as people who go to the Web or mobile site. Read the post on DealBook»

headline.main: DealBook: Those Millions on Facebook? Some May Not Actually Visit
